New Records: Jeffrey Vandersay's six-wicket haul is a significant achievement.
The defeat ends India's sequence of 11 consecutive bilateral series (2+ matches) wins in ODIs against Sri Lanka.
Key Match Events: Jeffrey Vandersay took 6 wickets, including key dismissals of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
Charith Asalanka picked up three wickets.
Washington Sundar picked up three wickets for India.
Kuldeep Yadav took two wickets for India.
Sri Lanka's Avishka Fernando scored 40 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lankan skipper Charith Asalanka opted to bat first after winning the toss.
Rohit Sharma-led India hoped for a more consistent performance after drawing the first ODI.
Post-Match Reflections: Jeffrey Vandersay was named player of the match.
The defeat ends India's sequence of 11 consecutive bilateral series (2+ matches) wins in ODIs against Sri Lanka.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka posted a total of 241 runs for India to chase.
India was bowled out for 208 runs in 42.2 overs.
Sri Lanka leads the three-match ODI series by 1-0.
